Report: Auburn interviewed MSU pitching coach Thompson Michael Bonner, The Clarion-Ledger 1:38 p.m. CDT October 13, 2015 According to a report, MSU associate head coach was interviewed by Auburn for its head coaching position on Monday. (Photo: Bruce Thorson-USA TODAY Sports, USA TODAY Sports) 3 CONNECT 12 TWEET LINKEDIN 1 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
STARKVILLE -- Auburn interviewed Mississippi State pitching coach Butch Thompson for its open head coaching position on Monday, according to the Montgomery Advertiser . 
Thompson denied an interview request made by the Clarion-Ledger. MSU coach John Cohen didn't immediately return a message asking for comment on the story. 
Mississippi State's only comment was, "We will not speculate on other (schools') coaching searches." 
Auburn's head coaching job opened last month with the firing of Sunny Galloway. Auburn athletic director Jay Jacobs said the dismissal was with cause, but wouldn't state specifics. 
Thompson was an assistant coach at Auburn from 2006-08. He joined Cohen at Mississippi State in 2009. He was promoted to associate head coach in 2012. 
Thompson won the Baseball America's Assistant coach of the year in 2014. He's regarded as one of the best pitching coaches in the country. Only Louisville and North Carolina have more strikeouts as a program since 2012. No team has induced more double plays in that time.
